msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 307 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 75; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 147 x 210mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1248 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 30: "90 E. H. 75. Mushaf. Aharlı krem rengi vassaleli kâğıt. 210mm boy ve 147mm eninde 307 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli nesihle 75mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Yaḳūt Cemaleddin al-Mustaʿṣimi eli ile 645 (1248) Ramazanında istinsah edilmiştir. Y. 1b, 2a da müzehhep iki levha içinde Fatiha ve Eliflām yazılıdır. Sure başları, hizip ve secde gülleri müzehhep, durak ve cetveller yaldızlı. Miklep, şemse, köşelik ve kitabeli sıvama yaldızlı viş[ne?] rengi deri cildin kitabesinde Ayet el - Kursi yazılıdır."

This can be translated as follows: "90 E. H. 75. Muṣḥaf. Cream-colored sized paper with vaṣṣālī. 307 leaves of 210 mm height and 147 mm width. The text area written in naskh with diacritics, [contains] 14 lines measuring 75 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt Jamal ad-Din al-Mustaʿṣimī during the month of Ramadan in the year 645 (1248). There are two illuminated plates containing the text of al-Fātiḥa and Alif-Lām on [leaf] L. 1b and 2a. sūra beginnings, hizbs and sajda roses are illuminated. Verse separators and and the rule-borders are gilded. Cherrybrown leather binding, with gilding (sıvama yaldız), and flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse), corner pieces and the inscription on the cover, written Āyāt al-Kursī.”
